document.docAuthor: Bu, Yun, Souza, Maysa Fernanda Villela Rezende & Ferreira, Rodrigo Lopes
document.masterDocTitle: A new locality of Koeneniodes madecassus Remy, 1950 (Palpigradi: Eukoeneniidae) in China, with the first complete redescription of a Koeneniodes species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new locality of Koeneniodes madecassus Remy, 1950 (Palpigradi: Eukoeneniidae) in China, with the first complete redescription of a Koeneniodes species

bibRefCitation.author: Remy, P. A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Remy, P. A. (1950) Palpigrades de Madagascar. Memoires de l'Institut Scientifique de Madagascar, Serie A, 4, 135 - 164.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
♀ , China , Guangxi , Chongzuo City , Daxing County , Mingshi Villa. Extracted from a soil sample collected under grass on the bank of Mingshi River ,
279 m
.a.s.l., 22°85’N / 106°73’E,
6–IX–2018
, leg. Yun Bu (slide no. GX–DX–PS2018006) ( SNHM )
.

Diagnosis. Frontal organ with two leafs–shaped and pointed branches, with fine reticulation; one single leafshaped blade with fine reticulation in the lateral organs; 5 setae on deuto–tritosternum; 10 pairs of setae on propeltidium; 3 pairs of setae on metapeltidium; cheliceral fingers with 9 teeth each; coxae II–IV with 3–3–0 thick setae; 5 setae ( grt , gla , r , and 2 esd ) on basitarsus of leg IV ; opisthosomal tergites II–VI with two pairs of t setae between one s setae on each side; opisthosomal sternites IV–VI with two slender setae ( s
1
and s
2
) inserted laterally; sternite IV with two rows of thick setae: one anterior with 16 setae inserted on tubercles and clustered together and one posterior with 3 pairs of setae ( a
1
, a
2
and a
3
); sternite V with two rows of thick setae: the anterior with 1 pair and the posterior with 3 pairs ( a
1
and a
2
with roundish and broad apex and inserted in the middle of the segment, a
3
slightly longer and inserted more laterally); sternite VI with two rows of setae: one anterior with 9 thick setae, and one posterior with 5 long setae; first lobe of female genitalia with 8 pairs of ordinary setae ( a
3
and a
4
five times longer than a
1
and a
2
) and 10 differentiated short setae inserted in large cavities (including 2 bud–shaped short setae) in its central region; second lobe with 3 pairs of setae.
Description. Body length without flagellum: 1100 ( Fig. 2 ).

Prosoma . Frontal organ 20 long, 10 wide, and formed by two leaf–shaped branches with pointed apex and reticulation present ( Fig. 3 ). Lateral organ with a one leaf–shaped blade (15 long, 5 wide) with fine reticulation ( Fig. 4 ). Propeltidium with 10+10 setae, 17–32 long ( Fig. 5 ). Setae t
1
, t
2
and t
3
of metapeltidium 43, 55 and 45 long, respectively ( Fig. 6 ). Labrum with 5+5 short setae (13–15 long) ( Fig. 7 ). Basal segment of chelicera 180 long (dorsal length) and 85 wide, with 6 proximal setae ( p
6
the thickest and densely barbed, 76 long; p
4
thicker than the remaining setae and densely barbed in most of its length, 45 long) ( Figs. 7 , 15 ), 3 distal setae smooth in their proximal third and with tiny projections in their distal part, truncated apically: d
3
longer (70) than d
1
(40) and d
2
(35) ( Figs. 7 , 16 ); and 1 apical pointed seta (40). Hand of chelicera 150 long (without fingers) and 85 wide, with 7 setae: 4 dorsal, 2 in exterior position (1 close to articulation of movable finger and 1 on a tubercle close to the teeth of the fixed finger), and 1 in interior position. Fingers with 9 teeth each, feather–shaped with an edging of tiny, densely set barbules ( Fig. 8 ). Deuto–tritosternum with 5 setae (15 long) arranged in two rows: the anterior with 3 setae and the posterior with 2 setae ( Figs. 9–10 ).

Coxal chaetotaxy . Pedipalp coxa with 19 setae ( Figs. 11 , 17 ); coxa I with 15 setae (including two tiny microsetae) ( Fig. 18 ); coxa II with 3 thick and 10 ordinary setae (including two macrosetae) ( Figs. 10, 12 , 19 ); coxa III with 3 thick and 8 ordinary setae (including one macroseta) ( Figs. 10 , 20 ) and coxa IV with 7 ordinary setae (thick setae absent) ( Figs. 10 , 21 ).

Pedipalp . tc with 9 normal setae ( Fig. 22 ); fe with 8 setae including 2 macrosetae ( Fig. 23 ); ti with 8 setae including
5 m
; bta1 with
1 m
and 1 normal seta; bta2 with 1 normal seta and
5 m
( Fig. 24 ); ta1 with
1 m
; ta2 with
6 m
; ta3 with 1 fs , 1 cs , 2 r , 15 normal setae ( Fig. 25 ); apical claw 15 long with short pubescent unguiculus (5 long) ( Fig. 25 ).

Leg I . tc with 14 normal setae including two small setae in proximal half (15 long) ( Fig. 26 ); fe with 9 normal setae; pa with 9 normal setae and 1 tb ( Fig. 27 ); ti with 9 normal setae; bta1 with 2 normal setae,
1 m
, 2 tb ; bta2 with
3 m
, 1 normal seta, 2 tb ( Fig. 28 ); bta3 with 1 r , 1 grt and 1 small seta; bta4 with
5 m
, 1 tb and 1 fs ; ta1 with 1 r ,
1 m
, 1 normal setae and 2 adjacent small setae (7 and 10 long, respectively); ta2 with
5 m
, 1 tb and 1 fs ( Fig. 29 ); ta3 with 3 fs ( fs
1
/ fs
2+3
) (branches with similar lengths), 2 r , 1 cs , 1 rs ,
15 m
and 2 normal setae ( Fig. 30 ).

Legs II and III
with nearly identical chaetotaxy. tc with 3 (leg II ) or 2 (leg III ) normal setae; fe with
1 m
and 4 normal setae; pa with 5 normal setae; ti with 5 normal setae; bta with 4 normal setae; ta with 1 r , 6 normal setae and 2 spatulate setae ( Fig. 14 ).

Leg IV
. tc with
2 m
and 1 small seta; fe with
1 m
and 2 normal setae; pa with 5 normal setae; ti with 5 normal setae; bta with grt , gla ,
r and
2 esd ( Fig. 31 ); ta1 with
4 m
; ta2 with 5 normal setae, 1
r and
2 spatulate setae ( Fig. 13 ).

Basitarsus of leg IV (IVbta)
with 5 setae ( grt , gla ,
r and
2 esd ). Seta r 15% shorter than the tergal edge of segment and inserted in its half (d r / IVbta = 0.53); gla inserted in proximal half, grt slightly distal to r ( Fig. 31 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–8.
Koeneniodes madecassus Remy, 1950
. 2, habitus, dorsal view; 3, frontal organ; 4, lateral organ; 5, propeltidium; 6, metapeltidium; 7, basal segment of the chelicera and labrum; 8, hand of chelicera. Scale bar: 100 μm in Fig. 2, others 20 μm.

FIGURES 9–14.
Koeneniodes madecassus Remy, 1950
. 9, deuto–tritosternal setae; 10, ventral view of prosoma; 11, coxa of pedipalp; 12, coxa of Leg II, arrows indicate the thick setae; 13, Ta2 of leg IV, arrow indicates the spatulate seta; 14, segments of Leg III and IV, arrows indicate the spatulate setae. Scale bars 20 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Opisthosoma . Tergite III with 3+3 setae ( t
1
= 40, t
2
= 48, s = 38). Tergites II–VI with 3+3 setae, two pairs of t setae ( t
1
, t
2
) between a pair of slender setae ( s ) ( Fig. 32 ). Sternite III with 2+2 setae (20 long) ( Fig. 33 ). Sternite IV with 16 anterior setae (20–28) on tubercles arranged as 8+8 and clustered together in the middle region of the sternite, and a row of 10 posterior setae: a
1
(30), a
2
(32), a
3
(30) short and thick (setae a
1
and a
2
inserted in the middle region, a
3
more laterally) flanked by the slender setae s
1
(34) and s
2
(20) ( Figs. 33 , 39 ). Sternite V with 1 pair of anterior setae (21) and a row of 10 posterior setae: a
1
and a
2
thick (about 30 long), with roundish and broad apex and inserted in the middle of the segment, a
3
slightly longer (33) and inserted more laterally, flanked by the slender setae s
1
(33) and s
2
(20); one pore observed between the a
2
and a
3
setae ( Figs. 33, 34 ). Sternite VI with two rows of setae: one anterior with 9 thick setae (28–32), and a posterior of 5 long setae (65–68) flanked by the slender setae s
1
(40) and s
2
(24) ( Figs. 33, 35 ). Segments VII–XI with 9, 12, 9, 9, and 8 setae ( Figs. 36–37 ). Two dorsal setae (14) on the intermediate ring of the flagellum are smaller than two ventral setae (25) ( Figs. 36–37 ). Pubescence of the opisthosomal segments IX–XI evenly short and dense. Flagellum lost.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–21.
Koeneniodes madecassus Remy, 1950
. 15, proximal series of setae ( p
1
–p
6
) on the basal segment of the chelicera; 16, distal series of setae ( d
1
–d
3
) on the basal segment of the chelicera; 17, coxa of left pedipalp; 18, coxa of left leg I; 19, coxa of left leg II; 20, coxa of left leg III; 21, coxa of right leg IV. Scale bar 50 μm. Thickened setae on coxae II and III are indicated by solid black arrows.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female genitalia. First lobe with 8+8 normal setae arranged in rows: 2+2, 1+1, 1+1 and 4+4 distal setae ( a1 = a2 = 17, a3 = a4 =70), and 10 microsetae inserted on the central region of the lobe with large insertion cavities (diameter as 5 μm), including 1 pair of thicker and shorter (bud–shaped) setae (8 long) and 8 slender and slightly longer setae (10–15) ( Figs. 38–39 ). Inner surface of the first lobe with a group of 3 orifices on each side and a medial pair of smaller orifices. Second lobe with 3+3 apical setae ( x = 28, y = 30, z = 28); presence of cuticular spines and a group of 4 orifices on each half ( Fig. 38 ).
Measurements (in μm) and indices are given in Table 1 .

TABLE 1 . Measurements (in μm) and indices of
Koeneniodes
madecassus
Remy, 1950
from Guangxi, China, and adult female from Hellville, Madagascar (in parentheses).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution.
Koeneniodes madecassus
was described from specimens collected in Madagascar (one adult female from Hellville, Nosy–Be, a small island of the northwest coast, and one immature of stage A from the surroundings of Ambanja) and La Réunion (one adult female from Sainte–Rose) ( Remy 1950 ). Later, the species was reported from other localities in La Réunion ( Remy 1952 ) and from other countries: Mauritius ( Remy 1958 ), Seychelles ( Condé 1997 ), Sri Lanka ( Remy 1961 ), Indonesia ( Condé 1990 ) and Hong Kong in China ( Condé 1993 ). We found it in Guangxi Province of China for the first time. All records are mapped in Fig. 40 .
